name: Tangkuban Parahu
description: Tangkuban Parahu is a stratovolcano 30 km north of the city of Bandung, the provincial capital of West Java, Indonesia. It is a popular tourist attraction where tourists hike or ride to the edge of the crater to view the hot water springs and boiling mud up close.

photo.name: tangkuban-parahu.jpg
photo.description: a small tree and a big crater in the background at daytime

name: Kawah Putih
description: Kawah Putih is a crater lake and tourist spot in a volcanic crater about 50 km south of Bandung in West Java in Indonesia. The lake itself represents a relatively stable volcanic system with no records of significant activity since around 1600.

photo.name: kawah-putih.jpg
photo.description: a tree in the side with a lightblue lake in the background at foggy daytime

name: Tebing Keraton
description: At 1,200 meters above sea level, Tebing Keraton is located within the Ir. H. Djuanda Forest Park, at Ciburial Village, Cimenyan sub-district, in the Bandung Regency. At the main area, there is a rock that bulges over the edge of the cliff which makes it a perfect place to observe over the incredible natural surroundings.

photo.name: tebing-keraton.jpg
photo.description: man standing on mountain top overlooking green-leafed trees at foggy daytime
